data.title: MK40 4PQ
data.meta_description: Discover everything you need to know about the MK40 4PQ Postcode in Bedford: from historical maps to top local attractions!
data.text:
MK40 4PQ is a postal code used within the United Kingdom for delivering mail.

Postcodes are made up of two parts. The part before the space (MK40) is called the outward code. The part after the space (4PQ) is called the inward code. The letters C, I, K, M, O and V are not allowed in the inward code. In addition to the inward and outward code, the postcode can be broken up into four parts:

Postal Area. In our case MK which means Milton Keynes.

Postal District. In our case MK40.

Postal Sector. In our case MK40 4.

Postcode Unit. The last two letters. In our case PQ.

The regional mail center for the post area MK is the National Distribution Centre, which is located at Danes Way, NORTHAMPTON, NN6 7DD.

The final port of call for any post addressed to the MK40 4PQ postcode is the local delivery office (DO) which is . Here the post will be sorted ready for delivery.

The properties in the MK40 4PQ postcode have the street address of Westbourne Road

It is situated within the post town of BEDFORD within the old postal county of Bedfordshire.

MK40 4PQ is within the town of Bedford.

The MK40 4PQ postcode area is composed of 0% residential properties, 25% commercial properties, and 75% public properties.

None Domestic Buildings in MK40 4PQ fall under these categories: .

The MK40 4PQ postcode belongs to a large building, typically reserved for corporate headquarters or sizable organisations receiving over 500 daily mail items. The current occupant is Westbourne Adult Education Centre, Westbourne Road.

Records indicate a Unique Property Reference Number of 100081208902 for this building, classified as a day centre.

The Council for this Postcode is Bedford Council, who are a Unitary authority. This means that they are responsible for providing education, libraries and maintaining highways as well as normal council duties such as council tax, rubbish collection, housing, environmental health and planning.

You can visit the website for Bedford at the following link Bedford.

How much is the Council Tax?

Bedford Council is responsible for collecting council tax. This will vary depending on which council tax band the property falls within. You can check the council tax band at the gov.uk website.

Once you know the council tax band you can view how much Bedford charge for that band by visiting the The Council Tax section of their website.

Planning Applications

When moving house to a new post code it is worth checking out what will be built in the neighbourhood.

Few people want to live next door to a building site, have their garden overlooked or have the views from their property ruined.

Visit the local planning department and search for planning applications in this postcode granted within the last three years or still awaiting a decision. This will give an indication of what could still be built.
